reviews.review_msg: A fun and friendly prof, extremely organized and helpful. This course is given for the first time and basically its all about neuro-system. Class average was B, wasnt a hard course just need to memorize a lot of stuff about the brain.

U need to study hard in his class. The content is interesting. There are a lot of writting assignments. The multiple choice questions are tricky, but the short answers and essay are easy. It is a writting intensive course, however, it is helpful if u pay attention.

Strange? Boring? Worst prof ever?? You people must've either: 1)not gone to class or
 2)did crappy and blame it on V.Grose
 Come on now, sure hes got the serious and 'mean' look during lecture, but he cracks the occasional joke to loosen the class up. He's also got funky looking sunglasses and drives a miata...what more can u ask for in a psyc prof

A very nice prof, he's clear with what he wants. Exams are a bit tricky, but reasonable, all MC. Attending lecture helps understanding the textbook. Definitely read the text. He's very strict with the paper deadline

not 2 hard, although there is a lot of reading and memorizing to do. didn't find the lecs too impt 4 the exam. fair marker for the paper (only 6pgs). lecs were boring only b/c they were 3hrs long.exams are managable as long as you put some time&effort in2 it. overall i would take another class w/him

The class is so boring and it is 3 hrs long. Most people don't go to class because the prof. basically memorize the textbook and present it to us. His notes are from the teachers' edition textbook, so he basically comes to class once a week to entertain us without having to do any preparation.
Horrible...very unfair marker (he's a lawyer so assumes he's right with everything)

Grading criteria for assignments and exams very unclear. You watch a movie and answer questions for the exams, but the questions were very subjective. Long lectures, which are often unorganized. He'll start a sentence and trail off, or say "I don't know where I was going with this." Gives unclear responses when you email for help. Decent movies.

His questions on the exams were very broad and i wasnt sure on what kind of answers he was looking for since most of the questions were based on opinion. I don't think I'm learning about psychology in this class. He was quite nice but his lectures are  boring.
Awesome prof and easy class. I would definitely recommend taking PSYC106 with Martin if you have even a slight interest in psychology.

I really wish there was a tutorial for this class so that we can engage in the material more with him. But, Martin is a really knowledgeable guy from his experience in the field, tons of stories to tell that are relevant and it definitely makes me question my perception of mental illness. Grading is kind of unclear.
Thought provoking class by a wonderful prof.

Fantastic prof. His lectures are hilarious and interesting, and he has a down-to-earth personality. He also has a refreshingly critical perspective of his own field that's rare among other instructors. Emphasis on deeper understanding of concepts. One of the best courses I've taken so far, definitely recommend taking a course with him if you can.

He's a genuinely awesome guy. Super friendly and good at explaining the course content. The tutor marker, Sarah, doesn't attend lectures and his assignments were based on things learned from lecture and your own thoughts - the marking seemed unfair

This is what every university prof should be like. Understanding, approachable, and keeps content interesting. So much of the course has real-life applications and it was a joy to take this class with Dr. Pollock.

AWESOME PROF! Very clear, easy marker, amazing guy. He is very approachable and will clarify anything you don't understand. Gives bonus marks with pop up quizzes, each bonus mark is .05% of your final grade, so it makes it worth it to study for the lecture! TAKE THIS COURSE WITH MICHAEL! He's amazing.
He is extremely helpful! Midterms are easy, just need to study notes. Makes a 3 hr lecture interesting! Definitely one of the best prof ever!

this guy is the best lecturer I've had at SFU. the class was 3 hours long, but he managed to keep the class interested.  the class was also super cool, im a science student and took it out of interest, I would def recommend it
No Comments

His lectures are not helpful cause the exam questions are solely based on reading material (which includes an enormous amount of articles).  However, he's extremely funny at lectures.  Memorize the reading material and you'd be okay.  And the project on serial killers was fun.

I had Sherrie Atwood for PSYC106 with remote learning during COVID. She was amazing. The course consisted of 13 assignments which were graded fairly easy by Sherrie and the TA. The assignments were easy and straight forward. They did not require too much work whatsoever. I definitely recommend taking her for any psychology courses!

Easy GPA booster. Im surprised that she even has a bad rating. I didnt know a thing about psyc, attended one full lecture, spent 2 hour max per week on assignments, and passed with an A. If u understand the general concept, assignments are easy, never got under a 90% on one. if you're able to get lower than an A, you shouldnt be in university.

taking her online class has been a real struggle - she seems to be totally incapable of being concise and efficient about her subject matter - her lectures are 10% information, 90% waffling bc she goes on and on about inconsequential details and lacks the ability to summarize topics in precise way that can be easily understood. avoid if able!!

I have never regretted taking a course more. No textbook, so all lecture based but problem is lectures are so boring and she goes off topic. A super subjective course. She rarely answers emails. Lecture slides contain WRONG information. Doesn't let you review your multiple choice tests when there's a good change it was marked wrong. AVOID HER.
Info heavy lectures

Ralph was a great guy but this course was solely based on sleep, which was super misleading to the course description when I registered. Lectures were also long and very boring. Make sure you do the practice questions and readings if you want to do well on quizzes and tests, but the lectures are not worth it to attend.

My biggest issue with this class is that it had nothing to do with "contemporary issues in society", it should've just been called "Sleep Psychology" because that is all he ever talked about. He is a very smart professor but my God his lectures are SO dry. The textbook was the only interesting thing about this class.

Had to write when I saw people defending this course. We expected to learn about Psychological Issues in Society, but instead the entire course is about sleep. Not kidding. The lectures are three hrs long and bored everyone to tears. For the entire semester Ralph's typo said the final project was due a month after it actually was. SO REGRET TAKING

I feel bad that everyone is mean to Dr. Mistlberger. Idk why everyone is so whiny. I think he is a fair marker and although his quizzes/exams are hard, he gives practice questions so u can still get good marks. This course requires lots of reading, but there is a really cool sleep project where you study yourself. He is v passionate about the topic

I understand why people are hostile towards Ralph he is a bit unorganized and lectures are boooorring. However, I learnt so much in this course because he is so knowledgeable in his field. People who are complaining probably did not put in the minimal work even needed in this class to do well. Study the textbook and it's an easy A

Ralph is passionate about sleep and not much else, tests are very fair and won't trick you. Don't show up for the lecture, just memorize the textbook. Textbook content is interesting but long/wordy/repeats itself. I found this class very easy, class avg was low likely because people studied the lectures but how can you blame them.

lecture slides are useless tests are based on textbook. he is an extremely unorganized prof, he didn't put out a syllabus until 2.5 weeks in, and the big project that is worth 20% of your grade is the most confusing. He does a poor job of explaining what it is and sends out many emails that just confuse us all. I don't recommend avoid!!!

This guy obviously does not care about teaching this class. Incredibly vague expectations. Might be better in a higher-level course. He bait-and-switched us, we thought we were learning about contemporary issues in Psychology but we are only studying sleep and a book written by his advisor. 1/10 would not recommend.

This guy is a joke. The class was called "Contemporary Issues in Society", but the entire course has been focusing on sleep (I don't mean people dozing off in the middle of a lecture, though, that happens too). He pretty much changed the entire focus of the course to fit his own interests. He is also very unorganized, loopy, and passive aggressive.

Lectures were very long and boring, although I genuinely liked Ralph as a professor. He is great at answering questions and you could tell he is thoroughly interested in the subject. Most students got bad grades in this class, probably because they would leave during the lecture. Overall it was okay.

He clearly has a passion for the material, but the course was very heavy for a first year course. Lots of readings to do. He goes off on tangents a lot, which makes it hard to pay attention for a whole 3 hours. Midterm was a lot easier than the final, but with the curve of the class, I ended up with an A even though I struggled through the final.

He seems like a nice guy and is very clearly interested in the field of sleep but often strays off on tangents and stories. Rarely gets through the scheduled modules set for each class so there's a lot of catchup reading to do at home. The class is non-cumulative and based almost completely on midterm/final marks Interesting subject overall though.
exam was all multiple choices. midterm worth 40%, final worth 45%. his ppt and notes were really helpful and and A LOT of details on them. which would be on the exams. interesting class.
